alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 11:39AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow, Strong Winds Possible Monday Night Into Tuesday Night ... .A winter storm will impact portions of the Upper Mississippi Valley Monday night through Tuesday night bringing the potential for heavy snow. However, any shifts in track will impact snow amounts, so monitor forecasts if you have travel plans, as travel impacts are likely. In addition to the snow, winds will increase to 20 to 30 mph with wind gusts up to 40 mph late Tuesday afternoon and continue into Tuesday night. This will result in blowing and drifting snow. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph from late Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday night. This would result in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...In Iowa, Fayette and Clayton Counties. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
